title: The Catalyst School - Multilanguage
description: How do we facilitate and support the participation of non-fluent/native English speakers in Project Catalyst?

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal will be really helpful for new proposer or community advisor that would like to learn more about Project Catalyst but with their own native language. The Catalyst School will likely to provide support in several languages for these new proposer or new community advisor.
f6_assessments.q1: I've seen their work and it really helps new people to learn more about Project Catalyst. This proposal is a part of their project to gain more audience via providing support/workshop with more languages. Budget is reasonable. And the team consist of veteran in Project Catalyst. This project will likely to success.
f6_assessments.q2: KPI is quite clear. Community can join and check the workshop or support via their meeting online. Plus there should be a documented/recorded session in Youtube if I am not wrong.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem of the difficulty of participation of non-English speakers in the Catalyst project was identified. A support group and 1-to-1 support in different languages was presented as a solution. This can be an important tool to help non-English speakers participate in Catalyst. The purpose of the proposal is aligned with the challenge and presents metrics to monitor the success of the work. The proposer has not presented any financial plan for the future other than Catalyst so it is not possible to assess whether it will be financially sustainable in the long term.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer presents a team with relevant experience to implement the project. The budget is well detailed and reasonable for the proposed work. The proposal has a realistic timeframe for completing the project. The proposal presents a detailed plan for conducting the work and does not pose any relevant risk to the success of the implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a roadmap and milestones. In addition, it also presents metrics for evaluating the project's success. Provides necessary and sufficient information to follow up on the success of the proposal

f6_assessments.q0:
In the proposal description it is possible to identify the problem, but the problem statement doesn't make the problem clear, I would recommend changing this.
The solution described is in line with the challenge and could allow the creation of a bridge for non-English speakers to have the necessary support. I understand the proposal as a complementary solution, because even with the support of CAs, vCAs and proposers they would still have to deal with a lot of information in English. E.g.
-CAs and vCAs need to read documentation and maybe watch videos to understand the process (this is still in English) and also need to write assessments in English. Some tasks assigned to CAs and vCAs can be solved with the help of automated translators, which may or may not be feasible for certain languages and situations.

-Proposers would need a mentor to write a proposal in English (as automated translation may not be sufficient for this) and maybe someone to promote it in English.

My point is that the proposal is positive, but its impact is limited by these factors.

The goal of supporting 100 people is a good indicator of impact, but I would recommend detailing what kind of information will be collected in the reports so that the impact assessment can be more objective.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal contains details that indicate the qualification and suitability of the members for this proposal. The Catslyst School is represented by a number of members involved in the Cardano community, with important contributions to the Catalyst project over time and with full capacity to provide support.

There is a reasonable plan, with a budget breakdown and a realistic timeline (the proposal will provide support, in Funds 7 and 8 or until it reaches 100 supports)
f6_assessments.q2:
There is clarity in the problem, solution and alignment of these with the challenge.

There is a simple and objective roadmap. The goal is clear, to support 100 people (CAs, vCAs, proposers or people involved in Catalyst). It is not clear what information will be included in the reports, which makes the auditability assessment difficult.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is one of a number of proposals from the Catalyst School team which seeks to address the problem of language as a barrier to growing a multinational Cardano. It is a valid problem and the team is quite systematic with their documentation and how the proposal will add value to the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: This team have an excellent track record of delivering excellent content to the Cardano community and appear to have the required experience to deliver this proposal. The plan presented is solid but does not tick all of the boxes comprehensively. How will participants be sourced? Considering we have finite resources how will participants be selected and whom will be selected to conduct the 1:1 sessions?
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is a solid effort that provides adequate information to assess what the team is intending to do. Perhaps some aspects could have been further explained and I have some minor queries about method but nothing of great concern. The project is easily auditable and I have confidence that this team will deliver for the community.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal appears well thought out and is a great value proposition for Catalyst and Cardano, exactly what the community needs for continuity.
f6_assessments.q1: The team behind the proposal is already well-regarded members of the community. The budget is provided but is off by 4 development hours or $200. The timeframe is provided, is reasonable and is measurable.
f6_assessments.q2: Upon domain registration audibility is live. The proposal ties into another proposal, "NFT Rewards", without much focus on the interaction and technicalities between the two.

solution: Provide 1-to-1 and group support in many different languages, increasing multicultural and international participation.
experience: Veteran advisors and proposal mentors, education professionals, very active Catalyst community members since early Funds and more.
